page.title: 10FARMING-A FARM VISIT
page.content: The farm we visited is typical of many farms in this area,but gradually these small farms are being taken over by large companies. The farm covers 80 acres and is not an arable farm,only grass is grown for animal feed.The fields are divided up by hedgerows, whereas many farmers these days root out hedges form more efficiency, sadly changing the ecology {MACHINERY} Mr Chapman has 2 tractors which use 250 gallons of diesel fuel annually. Among his machinery he has a hay tedder,trailer, dung spreader, roller and harrows.He like some modern methods but detests factory farming.He works the farm on his own,only employing help at haymaking time
